title: my usb disk have some problem ,any idea

forumNotes.author: boxitoy
forumNotes.content:
i have a usbdisk 4G,somehow it abnormal.i try to reformat it use any app,in vain don't solve the promble ,or in deem i don't know what the promblem in it,  
![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif) so i want someone can enlight my ear,so i won't bewilding.  
first ,i use windows embedden format tool to format it,but the hint me "windows can't reformat it."  
again , i use linux gPart reformat it ,still fail   
well, i was tired,i try use freedos app ,the result is same.  
addition i can't delete the content,but most files have crack by virus,soldem can be used. ![:smiling9:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/smiling9.gif)

forumNotes.author: VV2006
forumNotes.content:
**boxitoy**   
Make sure your flash drive is not locked - do not use by antivirus software, viruses or any other applications.   
Try to use for formatting flash disk proprietary utility from its manufacturer.

forumNotes.author: Holmes.Sherlock
forumNotes.content: * Is it an USB Flash disk / Pen drive ? * Who's the manufacturer ? * What's the actual size of the disk ? * Before this problem occured, did u try any other utility on the disk ?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Run RMPrepUSB Quick Test - to check if flash memory is OK  
Then run RMPrepUSB Clean  
Then try to format it using RMPrepUSB

forumNotes.author: boxitoy
forumNotes.content:
> Run RMPrepUSB Quick Test - to check if flash memory is OK  
> Then run RMPrepUSB Clean  
> Then try to format it using RMPrepUSB  

i will try it ,hope it give me some idea.  
thanks support this app

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
What I would do if I were you: * backup any data from the USB device * run Chipgenius on it: * get the info about the controller * find the Mass Production Tool for that controller * re-format the device at low-level (re-initialize)
Since you are from China, you should have NO problems in getting the tools, that are usually referenced on Chinese boards, if you have any problems, post the result of Chipgenius, and I'll try and help you find the appropriate tool. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Wonko

forumNotes.author: boxitoy
forumNotes.content:
at last i know it was a write-protect in my usb disk---HP 4G .it wasn't a switch lock, because it hasn't a switch on the side.  
ohh,my energy is over apply,like a waterpaper.

thanks you guys ,any futher pleas nob me up.
